content.question: This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question. (10 points, suggested time 20 minutes) The circuit above contains four identical <math alttext="10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="ohm"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistors. (a) Calculate the current through the battery.

frqParts.text: This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question. (10 points, suggested time 20 minutes) The circuit above contains four identical <math alttext="10"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="ohm"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistors. (a) Calculate the current through the battery.
(b) Rank the current in each resistor from greatest to least. If any resistors have the same current, indicate that explicitly. Use physical principles to explain your ranking.

(c) A capacitor is now added to the circuit below resistor 4, as shown above, and the circuit is allowed to reach equilibrium. Indicate below how this affects the current in each of the resistors. Increases Decreases Remains the same Resistor 1 Resistor 2 Resistor 3 Resistor 4 Use physical principles to explain your answer.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
